definition: to beat sb/to beat (a drum)
to hit/to strike/to tap/to rap/to knock/to rip sb off/to overcharge
dozen (loanword)
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
to make a continual banging sound/(fig.) to provoke with words
lit. to beat a gong; fig. to irritate sb/a provocation

sentences.english: Playing the cymbals can get fingers trained to work independently and build strength.
sentences.chinese: 敲打銅鈸可以訓練手指靈活性和力量。

sentences.english: When keyboarding, use minimum force while striking the keys.
sentences.chinese: 敲打鍵盤的時候，擊鍵時要使用最小的力氣。

sentences.english: Drums and gongs were beating boisterously.
Males prefer to use the sticks to whack each other.
sentences.chinese: 雄性小猩猩則喜歡用棍子互相敲打。

sentences.english: We knocked on the walls and spoke to our neighbors through the electrical sockets.
sentences.chinese: 我們在牆上敲打，透過插座和隔壁牢房的人說話。

sentences.english: He used to rap out messages on the wall when he was in prison.
sentences.chinese: 他在獄中的時候經常敲打牆壁來傳達信息。

sentences.english: Freezing both hands is beating a keyboard.
sentences.chinese: 氷凍悳雙手敲打著鍵盤。

sentences.english: The teacher hit the key and began to sing.
sentences.chinese: 老師敲打着琴鍵開始唱歌。

sentences.english: Fore the farmer bops my head.
sentences.chinese: 在農夫敲打我的頭之前。

sentences.english: Betty beat a bit of butter to make a better batter.
sentences.chinese: 貝蒂敲打一小塊黃油要做一塊更好的奶油麪。

sentences.english: Now, word comes from a computer beat, without a pen.
sentences.chinese: 現在，文字都是靠電腦敲打，不用筆了。

sentences.english: You beat word too injuriously, again to break my heart.
sentences.chinese: 你敲打的文字太有殺傷力了，又一次地把我的心敲碎。

sentences.english: He drummed his fingers on the table.
sentences.chinese: 他用手指在餐桌上咚咚地敲打。

sentences.english: When Moses struck the rock, it gave life-giving water.
sentences.chinese: 被摩西敲打的磐石，果然流出活水。

sentences.english: Does the average human mind have the capability to intuitively work with knock sequences?
sentences.chinese: 具有普通智商的人是否可以直觀地使用這種敲打序列？

sentences.english: He drummed on the table with his finger.
sentences.chinese: 他用手指咚隆咚隆響地敲打桌子。

definition: to pound/to rap
to smash a ball
to hit/to strike/to tap/to rap/to knock/to rip sb off/to overcharge
to make a continual banging sound/(fig.) to provoke with words
to pat/to slap/(of a bird) to flap (one's wings)
to move to and fro (with hand, foot, stick etc)/to fiddle with/to stir up
to beat/to pound/to thump
to stir/to prod/to poke/to move sideways/to strum (on a guitar etc)
variant of 捶[chui2]
to whip/to flog/to thrash
to beat/to lash
to smack/to beat
(coll.) to remove (crinkles, dirt) with the palm of the hand
to stroke/to caress
to rock/to shake/to sway
to move back and forth/to fiddle with
to flip over/to turn (a page)/to scroll (an electronic document)/to stir (food in a pot etc)/to move things about/to rummage
